TEXT.TITLE: U.S. BUDGET WRITERS TO DRAFT MEASURE JOINTLY
TEXT.BODY: Republicans apparently have ended their vote boycott at the budget drafting sessions of the House Budget Committee. House Budget Committee Chairman William Gray, a Democrat, announced that Republicans now would like to join in the effort to write a budget, but behind closed doors. Last week, Republicans refused to vote on any budget issues contending they had been left out of the process. The committee plans to meet tomorrow on a budget and Gray said he welcomes the "good faith effort" of the minority Republicans. Reuter
